content.title: Coir Vikas Yojana-Skill Upgradation and Mahila Coir Yojana
content.department: Ministry Of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises
content.details: The scheme 'Skill Upgradation and Mahila Coir Yojana' is a component of 'Coir Vikas Yojana (CVY)' launched by the Ministry of Micro, Small & Medium Enterprises, Government of India. It consists of two components: Skill Upgradation and Mahila Coir Yojana, aimed at creating skilled manpower for the coir industry through various training programs.
benefits: Financial assistance for training sponsoring agencies
Subsidy of 75% for coir processing equipment under Mahila Coir Yojana
Training on modern technologies and management skills
eligibility: Self Help Groups (SHGs), NGOs registered in the Darpan Portal of NITI Aayog, and Government Organizations can apply
Adequate infrastructural facilities such as work sheds, power connections, equipment, and raw materials are required
content.application_process: Offline application through Regional/Sub Regional Office of the Board.
documents_required: Proof of NGOs registered in the Darpan Portal of NITI Aayog
Details of the source of raw material for training
Details of availability of machinery for training
ID proof (Election ID Card/Ration Card/Aadhaar Card/PAN Card)

faqs.question: What is the 'Skill Upgradation and Mahila Coir Yojana'?
faqs.answer: The scheme conducts various programs like Entrepreneurship Development Programme, Awareness Programme, Workshop, Seminar, Exposure Tour, etc. to attract more entrepreneurs to start coir processing units.

faqs.question: What is the objective of this scheme?
faqs.answer: To train personnel, transfer technology, provide self-employment to rural women artisans, and inculcate quality consciousness among coir workers.

faqs.question: Which is the implementing agency of this scheme?
faqs.answer: Regional/Sub-regional offices/training centres of the Coir Board, Kochi.

faqs.question: What type of facilities should organizations have before applying under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Adequate infrastructural facilities such as work sheds, power connections, equipment, and raw materials.
